bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions and designation of restricted zones

bcl:definition.bcl:text: pat-frisk search means a hand search or a search by use of a hand-held screening device, conducted by a sheriff

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: of a clothed person, from head to foot, down the front and rear of the body, around the legs, and inside clothing folds, pockets and footwear, and
of any personal possessions, including clothing, that the person may be carrying or wearing;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: screening search means a search by a sheriff of a clothed person and any personal possessions, including clothing, the person may be carrying or wearing, that is conducted visually or with the use of a screening device, including without limitation, a walk-through or hand-held metal detector or a fluoroscope;
strip search means a visual inspection by an authorized person of a nude person that includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a visual inspection of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the open mouth, hands or arms of the person;
the soles of the feet and the insides of the ears of the person;
the person running that person's fingers through that person's hair;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person otherwise enabling the authorized person to perform the visual inspection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "restricted zone" in section 6.1 (1) of the Sheriff Act, the following parts of court facilities are designated as restricted zones:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the judges' chambers area, including all offices, passageways, elevators, work areas, lounges, libraries and storage areas primarily intended for the use of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: judges, masters and other judicial officers;
the judicial staff and court facility staff providing support to the persons referred to in subparagraph (i);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the court registry area, including all offices, passageways, elevators, work areas, storage areas and lounges primarily intended for the use of court registry staff;
sheriffs' areas, including all offices, passageways, elevators, work areas, storage areas and lounges primarily intended for the use of sheriffs;

bcl:section.bcl:text: A search conducted under section 6.1 (3) (a) of the Act or section 6.2 (2) of the Act may be conducted by a pat-frisk search or a screening search.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the circumstances allow, before conducting a strip search, a sheriff must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: inform the prisoner to be strip searched of the reasons for the strip search, and
explain how a strip search is conducted.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A strip search that is conducted by a sheriff must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: observed by one other sheriff or other peace officer,
carried out in as private an area as the circumstances allow, and
carried out as quickly as the circumstances allow.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following persons are authorized to enter restricted zones:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: judges, masters, other judicial officers, judicial staff, court facility staff, court registry staff and sheriffs;

a person admitted to a restricted zone by any of the persons described in paragraph (a) if and only for so long as the person remains in the restricted zone for the purpose for which they were admitted.
